headline.main: THE DEPARTMENT OF THE SOUTH.; OUR HILTON HEAD CORRESPONDENCE. NO NEW MILITARY MOVEMENTS--REINFORCEMENTS NEEDED TO JUSTIFY IMPORTANT OPERATIONS--BUSINESS ACTIVITY AT PORT ROYAL--GRAHAM'S PLANTATION--CHANGES IN GEN. HUNTER'S STAFF--PROPOSED TRIP TO FLORIDA, ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: The military excitement here seems almost to have died out with the echoes of the guns that de- cided the possession of Pulaski. The little affair on Wilmington Island, of which I wrote you, was like a sharp thundergust succeeding a wild tempest; but the lightning marked its path with blood. The real warfare of elements also ceased about the same time; and the peaceful landscape now sparkles and glows in the brightest of sunlight.

docs.snippet: The ship Black Prince, Capt. HOWES, arrived here this morning, from Ship Island 6th inst., vid Havana 15%, where she touched by convey Government dispotches to the United States Consul at that port. She also brings a large mail to this port.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM SHIP ISLAND.; Activity in Military and Naval Movements--The Expected Attack on New-Orleans--Gen. Butler's Forced to go Through the Lakes, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: W.G. COFFIN, Superintendent of Military Affairs, writes from Leroy, Coffey County, Kansas, under date of April 12:

docs.snippet: Gen. C.F. SMITH, the melancholy fact of whose death we learn from the West, was on officer of unsurpassed courage and skill; and his loss at the present time will be a great blow to the army of the Southwest, by the men of which he was beloved as was...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. C.F. SMITH, the melancholy fact of whose death we learn from the West, was on officer of unsurpassed courage and skill; and his loss at the present time will be a great blow to the army of the Southwest, by the men of which he was beloved as was no other commanding officer.

docs.snippet: The United States transport Boston, Capt. J.P. JOHNSON, from Port Royal, arrived yesterday morning.  She left Port Royal on the 22d, making the passage in 3 days 16 hours.

headline.main: FROM PORT ROYAL.; Arrival of the Transport Boston Movements of Our Vessels Health of the Troops.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States transport Boston, Capt. J.P. JOHNSON, from Port Royal, arrived yesterday morning. She left Port Royal on the 22d, making the passage in 3 days 16 hours.

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; Visit of the President to the French Frigate Gassendi. IMPERIAL HONORS EXTENDED TO HIM. Dangerous Counterfeits of Treasury Notes.OUR SPECIAL WASHINGTON DISPATCHES. COUNTERFEITS OF TREASURY NOTES. NEWS FROM GEN. BANKS. THE MIX CAVALRY. THE INVENTOR OF THE COMBUSTIBLE SHELL. MAJOR CRAWFORD A BRIGAPIER. RECOGNIZED. NAVAL APPOINTMENTS TO-DAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: VISIT OF THE PRESIDENT TO THE FRENCH FRIGATE GASSENDI. The President's visit to the French frigate Gas- sandi this aftenoon was an event of historical importance; it was the first time a President of the United States ever went on board of a foreign vesselof-war that ever came to Washington.

docs.snippet: Since my last letter steady progress has been made in the preliminary work for the capture of the fort. The Rhode Island and Connecticut troops alternate in picket duty, covering the engineers and their party while they are engaged, night and day.

headline.main: THE WAR IN NORTH CAROLINA.; Progress of the Siege of Fort Macon. The Location of the Batteries..Near Completion of the Work...Continual Firing from the Fort.Health of the Troops...Sanitary Affairsat Newbern.CAPTURE OF SECESSION CAVALRY. CAPTURE OF SECESSION CAVELRY. DEATH OF DR. LATEROP. HEALTH OF THE TROOPS. SANITARY COMMISSION. BODIES OF RHODE ISLAND MEN SENT HOME. APPEARANCE OF A REBEL STEAMER.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since my last letter steady progress has been made in the preliminary work for the capture of the fort. The Rhode Island and Connecticut troops alternate in picket duty, covering the engineers and their party while they are engaged, night and day.
